resources.string: Do not edit this value without technical knowledge
Your OctoPrint profiles have changed, do you want to save the new configuration?
Invalid profile name, please verify your value
You should provide at least an IP.\n\nDo you need some assistance?
You have entered a LAN IP in the WAN IP field.\n\nDo you need some assistance?
You have entered the same IP for both LAN and WAN fields.\n\nDo you need some assistance?
Invalid port value.\n\nDo you need some assistance?
Invalid LAN port value, port 22 is associated to the SSH protocol (Printoid communicates with OctoPrint over HTTP).\n\nDo you need some assistance?
Invalid WAN port value, port 22 is associated to the SSH protocol (Printoid communicates with OctoPrint over HTTP).\n\nDo you need some assistance?
Invalid OctoPrint API key.\n\nDo you need some assistance?
N/A is not a valid OctoPrint API key.\n\nPlease refresh your OctoPrint web interface, and contact the developer of OctoPrint is the problem recurs.
Invalid communication baudrate.\n\nDo you need some assistance?
Printoid failed to scan your QR code. Please retry, or type your API key manually.
The SSH configuration seems missing for the selected OctoPrint profile. Please complete it before sending SSH command.

You are about to create an OctoPrint profile to establish the connection between Printoid & your OctoPrint server. Following are some details about the requested values.

 [ℹ MAIN PARAMETERS]

 ✏ LAN IP: this is the IP address (or hostname) of your Raspberry Pi on your local network

 ✏ LAN PORT (optional): fill this field only if you have changed the default port (80), otherwise let this field empty

 ✏ WAN IP (optional): this is the public IP address (or hostname) of your rooter over the Internet (to access OctoPrint on the cellular networks for example)

 ✏ WAN PORT (optional): this is the port you have forwarded on your rooter in order to access to your server over the Internet.

 ✏ API KEY: you can find this information in the settings screen of your OctoPrint web-interface

 ✏ BAUDRATE: this is the communication baudrate of your 3D printer

 [ℹ ADVANCED OPTIONS]

 ✏ SSL (optional): enable this feature to communicate with HTTPS instead of HTTP

 ✏ BASIC AUTH (optional): enable this feature and provide your credential if you have activated the per-user authentication on your Raspberry Pi

 ✏ SSH CREDENTIAL (optional): this is the credential to log on your Raspberry Pi over SSH (used in the custom commands screen)

 ✏ SSH PORT (optional): this is the port on which one you've forwarded the port 22 (used when Printoid is connected over the Internet, locally the port 22 will be used)

 [ℹ MORE INFORMATIONS]

You can find more informations about the configuration of Printoid on the official website: %s

If server certificate is self-signed, you need to install the certificate to your device or enable option below, otherwise connection will fail.

 If server certificate issued by a known Certificate Authority (CA); it will work out of box, without installing to your device.

 Please read this article first: https://printoid.net/2017/01/12/important-printoid-and-full-ssl-support/
My server uses self-signed SSL certificate. I trust this certificate at my own risk.\n\n Please read this article first: https://printoid.net/2017/01/12/important-printoid-and-full-ssl-support/
Do not activate this feature if you have not been prompted to do so by the developer! This can causes connection issues depending on your server configuration.
Profile ID for this profile is %1$s\n\nCurrent profile ID is %2$s
Printoid is retrieving your public IP (WAN), please wait a few seconds…

Please be sure that this device is properly connected to the same network as your OctoPrint server.\n\n After that, you also need to ensure that you have configured your router in order to make your OctoPrint server reachable over Internet (3G/4G for example).
Printoid can\'t retrieve your public IP (WAN) for the moment
Please be sure that this device is properly connected to the same network as your OctoPrint server.\n\n Otherwise Printoid will not be able to find your OctoPrint server.
